issue.title: Add ES Modules

comment.body: Thanks for all your input. We've outlined some more detailed design thoughts in this RFC https://github.com/playcanvas/engine/discussions/5770

commits.message: Updated ESModule* naming convention to ScriptESM*
Added CORS flag to `npm run serve`

issue.title: SharedArrayBuffer feature request
issue.body:
Currently SharedArrayBuffer is disabled in Launcher, due to the current cross origin policies. This is a feature request to enable its support.

Additional info: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/SharedArrayBuffer#security_requirements

comment.body:
> We hope to get to this within the next few weeks. Does that work for you?

That will work for us. Thank you for the update.

issue.title: Make `npm run build` also trigger `npm run build:types`
issue.body:
Since we rimraf `/build/` we don't rebuild the types, which makes `cd examples && npm run build` fail (because Monaco editor depends on `build/playcanvas.d.ts`).

Solution is quite easy (simply trigger `npm run build:types`), but side-effects for example could be increased RAM usage, so the build could fail on cheap/overused VPS servers (which struggle with RAM).

I confirm I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/playcanvas/engine/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) and signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://docs.google.com/a/playcanvas.com/forms/d/1Ih69zQfJG-QDLIEpHr6CsaAs6fPORNOVnMv5nuo0cjk/viewform).

commits.message:
Make `npm run build` also trigger `npm run build:types` (#5768)

* Make `npm run build` also trigger `npm run build:types`

* fix lint

* fix lint 2nd time

commits.message: Adding ASSET_BASE_URL to support module importing

pull_request.title: Adding rollup replace
pull_request.body:
This PR covers an edge-case when using 'use_local_engine' during development with Script ES Modules. 

In this scenario the engine is running on 'localhost:51000' meaning that any modules imported via the engine are relative to localhost and not the document. This means that user ESM Scripts are incorrectly imported from localhost.

Rather than introducing any logic into the engine itself (this is only applies for local dev) or pointing to window.location. This PR simply allows us to replace symbols and inject the host url during development via 
```
ASSET_BASE_URL=https://launch.local-playcanvas.com/ && npm run watch
```
At final build, this will have no change on the build output.

I confirm I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/playcanvas/engine/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) and signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://docs.google.com/a/playcanvas.com/forms/d/1Ih69zQfJG-QDLIEpHr6CsaAs6fPORNOVnMv5nuo0cjk/viewform).

issue.title: Adding rollup replace
issue.body:
This PR covers an edge-case when using 'use_local_engine' during development with Script ES Modules.

Rather than introducing any logic into the engine itself (this is only applies for local dev) or pointing to window.location. This PR simply allows us to replace symbols and inject the host url during development via

comment.body:
I have a feeling that `jscc` would even replace assignments, e.g.

```js
const ASSET_BASE_URL = '';`
```

would turn into:

```js
const https://launch.local-playcanvas.com/ = '';
```

(kinda low-level C preprocessor)
